metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0239 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The internal DNS server in Samba 4.x before 4.0.18 does not check the QRfield in the header section of an incoming DNS message before sending aresponse, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUand bandwidth consumption) via a forged response packet that triggers acommunication loop, a related issue to CVE-1999-0103.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
